alert.note: Alert for Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 5:53PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Van Buren, northwestern Lee and north central Clark Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Donnellson, or 15 miles west of Fort Madison, moving southwest at 10 mph. If a landspout is reported, a warning may be issued. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Donnellson, Bonaparte, Franklin, Croton, Farmington, Indian Lake Park, Mt Hamill, Primrose, Lee County Fairgrounds, Shimek State Forest and Battle of Athens Campground. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
